titleproper.value: Guide to the Werner Brandt Papers <lb/><date>1951-1983 </date><lb/>(Bulk <date normal="1956/1983" type="bulk">1956-1983) </date><lb/> <num>MC.13</num>

author.value: Collection processed by New York University Archives staff.

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2018-10-23T14:52:20</date>

abstract.value: Werner Brandt was a professor of physics at New York University from 1961-1966. From 1967 onward, he was also the director of the university's Radiation and Solid State Physics Laboratory. Brandt was a pioneer in research on energy, matter, and radiation. This collection is comprised of his articles and reports from the period of 1951 to 1983.

p.value: Published citations should take the following form: Identification of item, date; Werner Brandt Papers; MC 13; box number; folder number; New York University Archives, New York University.
Donated by Professor Leonard Yamus at an unknown date. The accession number associated with this gift is 84.021.

Werner Brandt died of cancer in Sweden on 1 January 1983. At the time of his death, Brandt was nominated for the Legion d'Honneur. He is remembered for his research on matter, energy, and radiation, as well as his interests in music, art, and literature.

This collection houses the articles, writings, and reports by Werner Brandt. A majority of the articles come from the <emph render="italic">Physical Review</emph>. Included in the collection is one of Brandt's first publications, his translation of a 1669 treatise on Icelandic crystals by his ancestor, Erasmus Bartholinus. Materials date from 1951 to 1983.
